bibl.title: Pindar's Prosodia and the Classification of Pindaric Papyrus Fragments.
bibl.note: To be read together with: Ian RUTHERFORD, For the Aeginetans to Aiakos a Prosodion: An Unnoticed Title at Pindar, Paean 6, 123, and its Significance for the Poem, ibidem, pp. 1-21, 3 fac-sim. - I. The attribution of Pindaric papyrus fragments. - II. P. Oxy. XV, 1792 (= Pack2 1363): A papyrus of Pindar's Prosodia. - III. A survey of the poems preserved in P. Oxy. 1792. - IV. The Prosodia-fragments in the Teubner edition. - V. Some poems of uncertain 'genre' in P. Oxy. XXVI, 2442 (= Pack2 1360). - Appendix (pp. 46-59): Some remarks on the colometry and on the arrangement into books in the ancient editions of Pindar.
D'ALESSIO Giovan Battista, Pindar's Prosodia and the Classification of Pindaric Papyrus Fragments.
